Message:
The village chief’s letter was
full of repentance and regret.

“Milla, I’m sorry.
Before you returned,
I had colluded with
a few others in exiling
a number of villagers.”

“After that,
we were overtaken by greed,
believing that the more
people we eliminated,
the more we would
be able to eat.”

“We spent our days
culling one person at a time,
before quickly deliberating
who to get rid of next.”

“But, when we saw you singing
with your face so gaunt,
we suddenly felt deeply ashamed.

It was clear you had not
succumbed to the same desires
we had all fallen prey to.”

“We would likely only have
continued to elect others
to sacrifice.”

“Humans who become like
demons have no right to live.

That’s why, for all those
involved in the culling, I...”

“The future of this village is in
the hands of those who remain.
Please, make this a world where
no one needs to be sacrificed...”

The rest of the letter was illegible...
So, I couldn’t read any more...
